|wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Enable Semiconductor |eth_chip2_model=3VCardBus |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=10M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid=default |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=169.254.61.150 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:90:4B |oui_eth=00:90:4B |default_ch= }} [http://web.archive.org/web/20011212143818/http://hawkingtech.com/products/wa210.htm Product page on Hawking's old website (via archive.org)] This device is an [[Acer WarpLink 2412]].. which is a '''Gemtek''' manufactured device. :'''NWN''' FCC ID of OGD10410208.. The 10Mbit PHY is from '''Enable Semiconductor''' (which was absorbed into '''Lucent''' -> '''Agere''' -> etc). There is, unsuprisingly, no HTTP configuration interface for this device. ==nmap scan dump== 
$ sudo nmap -sU -p1-65535 169.254.61.150

Starting Nmap 6.00 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2013-03-21 22:26 EDT

1024/udp open|filtered unknown
